item.title: Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerability in Meeting Management
item.dc:creator: Ionut Arghire
item.description:
Cisco has released patches for three vulnerabilities, including a critical privilege escalation bug and a DoS flaw for which exploit code exists.

The post Cisco Patches Critical Vulnerability in Meeting Management appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Industry Moves for the week of January 20, 2025 - SecurityWeek
item.description: Explore industry moves and significant changes in the industry for the week of January 20, 2025. Stay updated with the latest industry trends and shifts.

item.title: SonicWall Learns From Microsoft About Potentially Exploited Zero-Day
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
SonicWall has credited Microsoft for reporting CVE-2025-23006, a critical remote command execution vulnerability possibly exploited in the wild.

The post SonicWall Learns From Microsoft About Potentially Exploited Zero-Day appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Record Number of Ransomware Attacks in December 2024
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
NCC Group saw over 570 ransomware attacks in December 2024, the highest number since it started monitoring them in 2021. 

The post Record Number of Ransomware Attacks in December 2024 appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: FBI/CISA Share Details on Ivanti Exploits Chains: What Network Defenders Need to Know
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The US government shared exploit chains, IOCs and post-incident forensics data to help network defenders hunt for signs of Chinese hacking gangs.

The post FBI/CISA Share Details on Ivanti Exploits Chains: What Network Defenders Need to Know appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: DHS Disbands Cyber Safety Review Board, Ending One of CISA’s Few Bright Spots
item.dc:creator: Ryan Naraine
item.description:
The Trump administration has disbanded the Cyber Safety Review Board (CSRB), ending one of the few bright spots at CISA.

The post DHS Disbands Cyber Safety Review Board, Ending One of CISA’s Few Bright Spots appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Application Security Firm DryRun Raises $8.7 Million in Seed Funding
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
DryRun Security has raised $8.7 million in a seed funding round for its AI-powered application security solutions. 

The post Application Security Firm DryRun Raises $8.7 Million in Seed Funding  appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Doti AI Raises $7 Million Seed Funding for Instant Access to Internal Company Data
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
Doti's platform uses AI to improve, automate, and streamline standard office and business processes across distributed and hybrid environments. 

The post Doti AI Raises $7 Million Seed Funding for Instant Access to Internal Company Data appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Call for Presentations Open for SecurityWeek’s 2025 Supply Chain Security & Third-Party Risk Summit
item.dc:creator: SecurityWeek News
item.description:
Join Us in Shaping the Future of Supply Chain Security - Don’t miss this chance to be part of the conversation addressing one of the most pressing cybersecurity challenges .

The post Call for Presentations Open for SecurityWeek’s 2025 Supply Chain Security & Third-Party Risk Summit appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Cyber Insights 2025: APIs – The Threat Continues
item.dc:creator: Kevin Townsend
item.description:
APIs are easy to develop, simple to implement, and frequently attacked. They are  prime and lucrative targets for cybercriminals. 

The post Cyber Insights 2025: APIs – The Threat Continues appeared first on SecurityWeek.

item.title: Over $380,000 Paid Out on First Day of Pwn2Own Automotive 2025
item.dc:creator: Eduard Kovacs
item.description:
$380,000 paid out on the first day of Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 for exploits targeting car infotainment units, operating systems, and chargers. 

The post Over $380,000 Paid Out on First Day of Pwn2Own Automotive 2025 appeared first on SecurityWeek.
